parent_disease: Malignant neoplasm of oral cavity and pharynx
reasoning: Oral and oropharyngeal cancer combined incidence from GLOBOCAN 2005: ~4-5 per 100k globally. Predominantly squamous cell carcinoma. Strong associations with tobacco use, alcohol consumption, HPV (oropharyngeal), and betel nut chewing in certain regions. Well-documented in cancer registries.
